meanings.sent1: The frantic puppy ran around the yard chasing its tail.
meanings.sent2: The children were frantic with joy when they saw the ice cream truck approaching.
meanings.sent3: The frantic squirrel forgot where it buried its acorns and started searching in all the wrong places.
meanings.sent4: The frantic pace of the city never seemed to slow down, like a never-ending race.
meanings.sent5: The frantic wind whipped through the trees, making them sway wildly.

meanings.definition: Desperate or wild with excitement, passion, fear, pain, etc.
meanings.sent1: She felt frantic when she realized she had lost her phone in the crowded mall.
meanings.sent2: The frantic mother searched frantically for her lost child in the park.
meanings.sent3: The frantic chef accidentally added salt instead of sugar to the cake batter.
meanings.sent4: His heart beat frantic in his chest as he waited for the exam results.
meanings.sent5: The frantic screams of the trapped bird echoed through the forest.
